definition: for the benefit of the reader
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
(literary) to offer food and drinks/to entertain
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: This paper summarizes the recent development in gold metallurgy in Russia.
sentences.chinese: 概括介绍俄罗斯金冶金技术发展状况，以飨读者。

sentences.english: It involves much useful information for readers.
sentences.chinese: 它涉及到了很多有用的资料，以飨读者。

sentences.english: I can show the real world to readers.
sentences.chinese: 我可以显示真实世界，以飨读者。

sentences.english: This paper summarizes the recent development in gold metallurgy in Rus.
sentences.chinese: 概括介绍俄罗斯金冶金技术发展状况，以飨读者。

sentences.english: Now on the main seven developing respects, try to analyse, to offer to the readers.
sentences.chinese: 现就其发展的七个主要方面，试加浅析，以飨读者。

definition: my unworthy manuscript (humble expr.)/my humble writing
to pick/to select/to take/to capture (data)/to acquire/to pick up (a signal)
